course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Black Women and Politics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Course Topic: Black Women and Politics. Black Women and Politics will introduce student to the study of Black woman and U.S politics while examining Black women's participation ac citizens, voters, activists, and elites.  Topics will include Black women's suffrage and feminism; the role of gender in shaping public opinion; political parties; and the ways Black women's boides experience policy making.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 2433, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: P. Dowe, Status: Open
